activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montreal D Greer

records.addlTxt: for Montreal Greer from Dodge Correctional for Status Conference on Thursday, November 10, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. - emailed RCSO at 8:48 a.m.
WRIT.
Proposed order for payment Atty Jamie McClendon
Invoice Atty Jamie McClendon

8:53 AM Defendant Montreal D Greer not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant has been refusing court until he gets an attorney.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to withdraw

1:34 PM Defendant Montreal D Greer appeared by video, in custody in RCJ.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Montreal D Greer.  Attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address motion to withdraw as counsel on file. 
Court confirms with defendant that he wants Atty Mcclendon to withdraw. 
State objects to Atty Mcclendon withdrawing from 21CF1473.
Atty Mcclendon responds. 
Court asks defendant about why he wants Atty Mcclendon to withdraw. 
BTC: Motion to withdraw: 21CF1391 & 21CF1473 DENIED but will allow 22CF1157. Finding of good cause to waive time limits in 22CF1157.
Motion hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim E.C (person, property, residence or family).

1:43 PM Defendant Montreal D Greer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Angove on behalf of Jamie Marie Mcclendon appeared by video for Montreal D Greer.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Jamie Mcclendon

11:17 AM Defendant Montreal D Greer not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Montreal D Greer.  Attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Defendant refused to come to court today. 
Atty Mcclendon indicates she has not been able to review it with his client but does not believe this is contested based statements made in the report. 
State put concerns on the record regarding defendant not being here. 
BTC: Court makes finding of competency based on the non-appearance. If the defendant contests report after meeting with Atty Mcclendon she is to contact the clerk to get a new date. Will set over for preliminary hearing. Atty Mcclendon will be appointed. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is competent to proceed

Examination to be conducted by Dr. Goebel on 9/5/2022 @ 10 a.m. at the Racine County Jail 717 Wisconsin Racine WI 53403.  **RCJ informed that Dr. will not be coming on holiday...but will do examination on 09-06-2022 at 2:30 pm**
forwarded to Br 10 for review.

Defense requests competency evaluation; defendant refuses to appear. 
State does not object
BTC: Defendant appearance waived. Competency ordered  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.

Competency hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
